intro: Serratula tanaitica, commonly known as the Tanaitic thistle, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. It features spiny leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Serratula tanaitica is often found in scrublands and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
